title: Comfort and Sovereignty
shortSummary: Isaiah 40 marks a powerful message of comfort and hope to the people of Israel, assuring them of God's forgiveness and sovereign power. It emphasizes God's incomparable greatness as Creator and Sustainer, encouraging believers to trust in His strength and faithfulness amid trials.
timeline: c. 6th century BC - Babylonian Exile period

keyCharacters.name: God
keyCharacters.description: The sovereign LORD who speaks comfort to His people, reveals His power as Creator, and promises restoration.

keyCharacters.name: Isaiah
keyCharacters.description: The prophet delivering God's message of comfort and hope to Israel during their exile.

keyCharacters.name: The Voice in the Wilderness
keyCharacters.description: A prophetic figure calling for preparation of the LORD’s way, symbolizing the coming of God's salvation.

keyCharacters.name: Zion/Jerusalem
keyCharacters.description: Personified as the recipient of God's comfort and the herald of His coming glory.

definitions.definition: To console or encourage, especially in times of distress; here, God's assurance of forgiveness and restoration.
A barren or desolate place symbolizing spiritual preparation and purification for God's coming.
The visible manifestation of God's presence and majesty, revealing His holiness and power.
A title emphasizing God's eternal nature, unchanging character, and infinite wisdom.
To be spiritually and physically refreshed by trusting in God’s power and timing.

outline.heading: God’s Comfort to His People
outline.description: God commands comfort for His people, announcing the end of their punishment and the forgiveness of their sins, signaling hope and restoration.

outline.heading: Preparation for the LORD’s Coming
outline.description: A voice calls for making a straight way for God, symbolizing the removal of obstacles for His revealing glory to all humanity.

outline.heading: The Transience of Man vs. God’s Eternal Word
outline.description: Human life is compared to fading grass and flowers, contrasting with the enduring and unchanging word of God.

outline.heading: God’s Sovereign Power and Majesty
outline.description: God’s incomparable power as Creator and ruler over all nations is proclaimed, highlighting His wisdom and authority above idols and earthly rulers.

outline.heading: God’s Strength for the Weary
outline.description: God encourages His people not to despair, promising renewed strength and endurance to those who trust in Him.

application: Trust in God’s sovereign power and eternal word when facing personal trials or uncertainties.
Prepare your heart and life to receive the Lord by removing spiritual obstacles and embracing His truth.
Find comfort in God’s forgiveness and faithfulness, knowing He renews strength for the weary through dependence on Him.
Proclaim the good news of God’s salvation boldly, just as Zion is called to lift up her voice with strength.

keyVerses.text: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: but the word of our God shall stand for ever.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the eternal, unchanging nature of God's word in contrast to the fleeting nature of human life.

keyVerses.text: Hast thou not known? hast thou not heard, that the everlasting God, the LORD, the Creator of the ends of the earth, fainteth not, neither is weary? there is no searching of his understanding.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights God's infinite strength and wisdom, encouraging believers to trust in His unfailing power.

keyVerses.text: But they that wait upon the LORD shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
keyVerses.significance: This verse offers hope and assurance that reliance on God brings spiritual renewal and endurance.

keyVerses.text: The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the LORD, make straight in the desert a highway for our God.
keyVerses.significance: It calls for spiritual preparation for God's coming, a key theme of repentance and readiness for salvation.
